# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    words = split(s)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, strip(current_line))
            current_line = word * " "
        else
            current_line *= word * " "
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, strip(current_line))
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage
example_string = "This is a sample string that will be wrapped."
wrapped_string = wrap_string(example_string, 10)
println(wrapped_string)
```
